thread.title: Magic waive Sibert, who’s expected to play in D-League
thread.title_full: Magic waive Sibert, who’s expected to play in D-League

title: Magic waive Sibert, who’s expected to play in D-League
text:
Posted: 9:30 p.m. Monday, Oct. 19, 2015 Magic waive Sibert, who’s expected to play in D-League Related Staff Writer COLUMBUS — 
The Orlando Magic waived former Dayton Flyers guard Jordan Sibert on Monday. He’s expected to play for the Erie (Pa.) Bayhawks in the NBA D-League once he clears waivers. 
Sibert, who signed as a free agent with the Magic in September after not being drafted in June, appeared in five preseason games, averaging 6.1 minutes per game. He scored three points. 
The Magic also cut Keith Appling, of Michigan State. They have 17 players on the roster and have to be at 15 by the end of the week. 
The Erie Bayhawks were formed in 2008. They were originally a Cleveland Cavaliers affiliate and then the Philadelphia 76ers. They open the season Nov. 14 at the Westchester (N.Y.) Knicks. More News
